intro: Pultenaea juniperina, commonly known as the Juniper Bush Pea, is a shrub native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Pultenaea juniperina is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
